snippet: The collapse of spending measures increased the prospects of a government shutdown in the fall and added new urgency to fiscal negotiations between the White House and a bloc of Senate Republicans.
abstract: Congress, hours before leaving on summer recess, hits seemingly intractable impasse on government spending leading from Republican rifts, increasing prospects of government shutdown in fall and adding new urgency to fiscal negotiations between White House and bloc of Senate Republicans; collapse of spending measures leaves leaders of both parties pointing fingers.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: The collapse of spending measures increased the prospects of a government shutdown in the fall and added new urgency to fiscal negotiations between the White House and a bloc of Senate Republicans.

headline.main: G.O.P. Rifts Lead Congress to Spending Impasse
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Rifts Lead Congress to Spending Impasse
